info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 8 at 7:57AM EDT until June 9 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Elkhorn Creek Near Peaks Mill affecting Franklin County.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Elkhorn Creek near Peaks Mill.
* WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillhouse Hollow Road floods. At 11.0 feet, Schoolhouse Road floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1100 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING
